A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: When a movie lacks exceptional character development\, has a Disney princess wielding a lightsaber who is omnibenevolent and apparently omnipotent and is facing down someone she's already beat twice\, turns a space opera into a quirky space comedy\, introduces Porgs as if there was no backlash to cute creatures who actually served a purpose\, weakens\, dumps on\, and ghosts one of the greatest heroes in film history\, forces a \"love\" story that is incomprehensibly lackluster\, and is forcefully and abrasively shoving diversity propaganda down my senses (diversity is important\, but I just feel like there are other stages that can have more effective results; however\, I think it's a cool thing to do\, I just wish it was more subtle)\, I look to enjoy the movie as entertainment. It was entertaining and had some great moments. I love Star Wars\, and can be picky as hell. This was someone else's vision and I think it's cool that they got to see it become a reality. 3 Stars because I enjoyed watching it for the most part.
